member.name: T:Pololu.UsbWrapper.TransferStatus
member.summary: Represents the current status of the request.

member.name: F:Pololu.UsbWrapper.TransferStatus.Pending
member.summary: The request has not been processed yet.

member.name: F:Pololu.UsbWrapper.TransferStatus.Completed
member.summary: The request was successfully completed. This does NOT mean that the host received all the data.

member.name: F:Pololu.UsbWrapper.TransferStatus.Error
member.summary: There was an error completing this request.

member.name: F:Pololu.UsbWrapper.TransferStatus.TimedOut
member.summary: The device took too long to send data, so the request timed out.

member.name: F:Pololu.UsbWrapper.TransferStatus.Cancelled
member.summary: The request was cancelled by the application.

member.name: F:Pololu.UsbWrapper.TransferStatus.Stall
member.summary: The device responded to the request with a STALL packet (halt condition).

member.name: F:Pololu.UsbWrapper.TransferStatus.NoDevice
member.summary: The device was disconnected.

member.name: F:Pololu.UsbWrapper.TransferStatus.Overflow
member.summary: The device sent more data than was requested.

member.name: T:Pololu.UsbWrapper.DeviceListItem
member.summary: A class that represents a device connected to the computer. This class can be used as an item in the device list dropdown box.

member.name: F:Pololu.UsbWrapper.DeviceListItem.deviceInstance
member.summary: Gets the device instance (DEVINST) for this device. This can be passed in WinusbHelper.connect() to connect the device.

member.name: F:Pololu.UsbWrapper.DeviceListItem.guid
member.summary: The guid of the Windows device interface class of this device.

member.name: F:Pololu.UsbWrapper.DeviceListItem.serialNumber
member.summary: The USB serial number string of the device.
member.remarks: Since the serial number is needed by most applications, and used to generate deviceListItem.text, it is not a big waste to always fetch it when creating the device list.

member.name: F:Pololu.UsbWrapper.DeviceListItem.productId
member.summary: The USB product ID of the device.

member.name: M:Pololu.UsbWrapper.DeviceListItem.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Guid,System.String,System.String,System.UInt16)
member.summary: Constructs a new device list item to represent a device connected to this computer.
member.param: The device instance (DEVINST) of the device, typically returned from Winusb.listGetDeviceInstance.
Text that identifies the device to the user.
The device instance GUID (from the INF file).
The serial number of the device (from the string descriptor).

member.name: M:Pololu.UsbWrapper.DeviceListItem.CreateDummyItem(System.String)
member.summary: Creates an item that doesn't actually refer to a device; just for populating the list with things like "Disconnected"

member.name: M:Pololu.UsbWrapper.DeviceListItem.isSameDeviceAs(Pololu.UsbWrapper.DeviceListItem)
member.summary: Return true if the two devices are the same.

member.name: P:Pololu.UsbWrapper.DeviceListItem.text
member.summary: The text to display to the user in the list to represent this device. By default, this text is "#" + serialNumberString, but it can be changed to suit the application's needs (for example, adding model information to it).

member.name: T:Pololu.UsbWrapper.Usb
member.summary: A static class that has some methods for interacting with the operating system's USB support.

member.name: M:Pololu.UsbWrapper.Usb.getPortNames(System.String)
member.summary:
Returns a list of port names (e.g. "COM2", "COM3") for all currently-connected devices in the Ports list in the Device Manager whose device instance ID begins with the given prefix string.
For example, to get the port names of the umc01a bootloader, give a prefix of = USB\PID_1FFB&PID_0082.
member.param: The string that we match against the device instance ID. The device instance ID of the device you want must begin with this string.

member.name: F:Pololu.UsbWrapper.Usb.WM_DEVICECHANGE
member.summary: A constant needed for processing device change messages in Windows. See notificationRegister for details.

member.name: M:Pololu.UsbWrapper.Usb.notificationRegister(System.Guid,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Registers your form to receive notifications from the OS when one of a particular class of devices is removed or attached. See Usb.WM_DEVICECHANGE for example code for receiving notifications. You should only call this if supportsNotify returns true or your application will only be run on Windows.
member.param: The device interface GUID of the device you are interested in (from the INF file).
The handle of the form that will receive notifications (form.Handle).
member.returns: A handle representing this notification request.

member.name: P:Pololu.UsbWrapper.Usb.supportsNotify
member.summary: Return true if the operating system supports notifying forms when a device is connected or disconnect from the system. Currently returns true for Windows, false for Linux. See notificationRegister for details.

member.name: T:Pololu.UsbWrapper.UsbDevice
member.summary: An abstract class whose instances represent a connection to a USB device. When the connection is broken, the instance will stop functioning. This class currently has mechanism to automatically re-connect, but you can implement it in your application.

member.name: M:Pololu.UsbWrapper.UsbDevice.getSerialNumber
member.summary: Returns the serial number of device. It's a string because that is how they are transmitted over USB. For PIC18-based Pololu devices, this will be an 8-digit decimal number. For STM32-based Pololu devices, this will be a 24-digit hex number.

member.name: M:Pololu.UsbWrapper.UsbDevice.getProductID
member.summary: Returns the product ID of the device. Every Pololu USB product that has a different product ID (except those that have identical firmware). Each product's bootloader has its own product ID as well.

member.name: M:Pololu.UsbWrapper.UsbDevice.controlTransfer(System.Byte,System.Byte,System.UInt16,System.UInt16)
member.summary: Performs a control transfer that has no data stage. Returns when the control transfer is complete. There is a 50 ms timeout so that a malfunctioning device will not cause your program to hang.
member.remarks: For more info, see section 9.3 of the USB Specification.

member.name: M:Pololu.UsbWrapper.UsbDevice.controlTransfer(System.Byte,System.Byte,System.UInt16,System.UInt16,System.Byte[])
member.summary: Performs a control transfer that has a data stage. The data either flows from the device to the host or the host to the device. The direction is determined by RequestType. Returns when the control transfer is complete. There is a 50 ms timeout so that a malfunctioning device will not cause your program to hang.
member.remarks: For more info, see section 9.3 of the USB Specification.

member.name: M:Pololu.UsbWrapper.UsbDevice.controlTransfer(System.Byte,System.Byte,System.UInt16,System.UInt16,System.Void*,System.UInt16)
member.summary: Performs a control transfer that has a data stage. The data either flows from the device to the host or the host to the device. The direction is determined by RequestType. Returns when the control transfer is complete. There is a 50 ms timeout so that a malfunctioning device will not cause your program to hang.
member.remarks: For more info, see section 9.3 of the USB Specification.

member.name: M:Pololu.UsbWrapper.UsbDevice.#ctor(Pololu.UsbWrapper.DeviceListItem)
member.summary: Connect to the USB device specified by the DeviceListItem.

member.name: M:Pololu.UsbWrapper.UsbDevice.disconnect
member.summary: Disconnects from the USB device, freeing all resources that were allocated when the connection was made. This is the same as Dispose().

member.name: M:Pololu.UsbWrapper.UsbDevice.Dispose
member.summary: Disconnects from the USB device, freeing all resources that were allocated when the connection was made. This is the same as disconnect().

member.name: M:Pololu.UsbWrapper.UsbDevice.getDeviceList(System.Guid)
member.summary: gets a list of devices

member.name: M:Pololu.UsbWrapper.UsbDevice.getDeviceList(System.UInt32,System.UInt16[])
member.summary: This is used in the linux version to search by vendor and product ID

member.name: M:Pololu.UsbWrapper.UsbDevice.isSameDeviceAs(Pololu.UsbWrapper.DeviceListItem)
member.summary: true if the devices are the same

member.name: P:Pololu.UsbWrapper.UsbDevice.deviceInstance
member.summary: Returns an integer uniquely identifying the device among devices currently available.
